main event: A small elongated orange colored light was observed on September 13, 1961, during a NASA experiment launch, which released sodium material visible over a large distance.
interesting points: The light was observed at a maximum brightness and then dimmed, resembling a miniature moon., The phenomenon was visible up and down the Atlantic seaboard and as far inland as areas in the mid-western U.S., The sighting lasted approximately 15-20 seconds according to one witness., Multiple reports of unusual celestial phenomena were made on the same date., The light changed in appearance and quickly faded after becoming very bright.
sighted object: A small elongated orange colored light
witness description: R. J. Clarke, QM1, USS Randolph and another officer
